hints_html: Find the roots of the auxiliary polynomial.
hints_latex: Find the roots of the auxiliary polynomial.
hints_raw: Find the roots of the auxiliary polynomial.
question: 1 (g)
sols_html:
The auxiliary polynomial is

\[\begin{aligned} r^{2} - 2r + 2\end{aligned}\]

Solving for \(r\) when the above is set to 0 yields

\[\begin{aligned} r = \frac{-(-2) \pm \sqrt{(-2)^{2} - 4(1)(2)}}{2} = \frac{2 \pm \sqrt{4-8}}{2} = 1 \pm i\end{aligned}\]

where \(i = \sqrt{-1}\). Thus, the general solution is

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle y = e^{x}(C\cos(x) + D\sin(x))\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
The auxiliary polynomial is

:<math> r^{2} - 2r + 2 </math>

Solving for <math> r </math> when the above is set to 0 yields

:<math>
r = \frac{-(-2) \pm \sqrt{(-2)^{2} - 4(1)(2)}}{2} = \frac{2 \pm \sqrt{4-8}}{2} = 1 \pm i
</math>

where <math> i = \sqrt{-1} </math>. Thus, the general solution is

:<math>
\displaystyle y = e^{x}(C\cos(x) + D\sin(x))
</math>
statement_html: Determine the general solution of the differential equation \(y'' - 2y' + 2y = 0\).
statement_latex:
Determine the general solution of the differential equation
$y'' - 2y' + 2y = 0$.
statement_raw: Determine the general solution of the differential equation <math> y'' - 2y' + 2y = 0 </math>.
